results.title: Magdalena Abakanowicz workshop, Cell Block Theatre, Sydney
results.creator_credit: Christopher McGill, Malcolm Otton and Film Australia
results.brief_description: At her four day workshop in Sydney’s Cell Block Theatre in 1976, Magdalena tries to draw the students’ attention to problems like shape, scale, tension between forms space and light. The workshop is shown in progress in four stages of development. Narration by Anne Haddy.

results.title: Diving fundamentals
results.creator_credit: Norman L. Sper and New Official Films
results.brief_description: Opens with a brief history of the sport of diving followed by a demonstration and explanation of the fundamental techniques of diving including the correct way of take-off and lift, entry into the water, proper arm action and body positioning. Commentary by Ken Carpenter. Instruction by Fred Cady.

results.title: Diving
results.brief_description: A very detailed instructional film, explaining the fundamentals of diving, and demonstrating all the most popular championship dives with the aid of slow and stop-motion photography.

results.title: Distributing heat energy
results.brief_description: Coal, Gas, oil, electricity and wood are all sources of heat. Coal, oil, and gas are used as furnace fuels. Home heating has developed from the colonial fireplace of the early American settler to the modern steam, gas, or electric radiator. Heat transfer is carried out by conduction, convection, and radiation. All these points are studied in this film.

results.title: Distant neighbours
results.creator_credit: John Durst, Humphrey Swingler, British Petroleum and Greenpark Productions
results.brief_description: Illustrates the importance of light aircraft in maintaining communications with remote settlements, showing services operating in the Isle of Barra in the Outer Hebrides, in the frozen North-West Territory of Canada and in the desert outback of Central Australia.

results.title: Dispute
results.creator_credit: Fred Moore, Leon Clore and Basic Films
results.brief_description: A study of a typical industrial dispute and the real reason behind it. A personal incident between an operative and a foreman grows, until the whole factory is brought to a stand-still. Concentrates in turn on the operative, the foreman, the shop steward and the factory manager, showing how each of them came to take the attitude he did and how each felt he had no alternative and was unable to withdraw.

results.title: The Dispersal of seeds and fruits
results.brief_description: Considers the origin of seeds and fruits and discusses the need to spread these structures in order to avoid excessive competition, and to spread the species. Illustrates the agencies for dispersal - wind, animal and less common, water.

results.title: A Discussion in history
results.brief_description: Illustrates the technique of discussion as a method of teaching at senior high school level, and shows how a well-planned discussion may yield a deeper and clearer understanding of ideas. The subject of the french Revolution is introduced by the lecturer, who then leads the group in an unrehearsed discussion on various aspects of the subject.

results.title: Discovering the music of Japan
results.creator_credit: Bernard Wilets and BFA Educational Media
results.brief_description: In a beautiful teahouse setting, three of the major Japanese instruments - the Koto, the Samisen and the Shakuhachi - are shown. Historical background on each instrument and the ways they fit into current Japanese life are explained. Includes traditional Japanese singing and dancing, and a performance by an ensemble of the three instruments. Suitable for upper primary and secondary levels.

results.title: Discovering the forest
results.creator_credit: Thomas Smith and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description: Presents the story of the forest community; discussing its conditions, forms of life and inter-relationships. The mood of the forest is established through its own atmosphere, sounds and life - there is no narration. Designed to encourage children to observe, and then interpret their observations.
